image.altText: A photo showing pants and land with an ocean view with building in background.

props.synopsis: A case of leprosy has been detected in the Northern Territory, prompting outcry over remote living conditions for Indigenous Australians.

title.children: Leprosy detection highlights 'national shame' of Indigenous health inequalities, experts say

image.altText: A photo of a four people wearing black clothes walking out a building.

props.synopsis: The murder trial of Keith Kerinauia has heard the mother of stabbing victim Declan Laverty, who was allegedly murdered while working at a Darwin bottle shop in 2023, was aware her son carried a knife to work, and had encouraged him to do so for his own protection.

title.children: Court hears mother of man fatally stabbed at bottle shop encouraged her son to carry a knife at work for protection

image.altText: Side by side photos of business logos for accounting firms Deloitte, PwC, KPMG and EY

props.synopsis: PwC's tax scandal isn't over yet, with a new Senate probe demanding the firm hand over the name of staff involved in the affair.

title.children: Big Four consulting firms 'operating in the shadows for too long' as Senate committee demands new rules for government contracts

image.altText: Hayley Harrison jogging through a park.

props.synopsis: Heavy menstrual bleeding affects one in four women but despite the pain and disruption it causes, only half seek medical help. Doctors are trying to change that.

title.children: Hayley's periods were so heavy she had an iron deficiency. It was 18 years until she found out it wasn't normal

image.altText: New NT prison

props.synopsis: The NT coroner finds Aboriginal man Mr Dooley, who died in police custody in 2022, may have been experiencing the effects of cardiac arrest for up to two days before an ambulance was called to the Darwin prison.

title.children: Aboriginal man possibly suffered cardiac arrest effects two days before hospitalisation, NT coroner finds

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus holds up her hand

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus breaks the 200m freestyle world record by almost a second to pip world champion Mollie O'Callaghan.

title.children: Ariarne Titmus smashes 200m world record in stunning head-to-head with Mollie O'Callaghan

image.altText: A man in a suit looks up.

props.synopsis: Jerry West, the Hall of Fame player and executive who was the inspiration for the NBA logo, has died at age 86, the Los Angeles Clippers have announced.

title.children: Basketball legend behind NBA logo inspiration, Jerry West dead at 86

image.altText: A burnt-out car sits next to a burning car with flames and black smoke pouring from it on a motorway surrounded by green trees

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron's decision to hold a snap election in France has further delayed the implementation of the controversial changes, which sparked five weeks of violent riots.

title.children: 'Too many': Ninth person dies in New Caledonia riots as French president suspends controversial voting reform

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Defence lawyers for the man accused of murdering two campers in Victoria's High Country have attempted to tear apart the prosecution's case, arguing the retirees' deaths were tragic accidents.

title.children: ‘Complete factual vacuum’: Scathing closing arguments in alleged camper killer trial

image.altText: a design of an orange sculpture with what appears to be mangoes hanging off it

props.synopsis: On the 50th anniversary of one of Australia's worst ever natural disasters, hundreds of survivors have criticised a planned monument being built in tribute to the tragic event.

title.children: 'Mango tree': Strong criticism from cyclone survivors over $700k public art paying tribute to Cyclone Tracy disaster

image.altText: A man in a white short holding a piece of clothing leaves a prison with a man following him from behind.

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old was last year sentenced to nearly five years in prison for sexually assaulting a woman in her Newcastle home on the night of the 2018 NRL grand final.

title.children: Jarryd Hayne released from jail after sexual assault convictions quashed

image.altText: Paramedic sits in car park with ambulance in background

props.synopsis: All five Darwin ambulances are at times unable to respond to emergencies due to delays paramedics face offloading patients at the Northern Territory's largest hospital, St John Ambulance NT has revealed.

title.children: 'There's no free ambulance': Delays at NT hospital leaving paramedics unable to respond

image.altText: A man stands in front of a helicopter

props.synopsis: When a person goes missing along the iconic Larapinta Trail in Central Australia, search and rescue pilot Warwick Curr is often one of the first people to know. After 20 years, the job never gets easier.

title.children: Pilot lays bare highs and lows of 'intense' job finding missing people on famed outback trail

image.altText: People walk amongst rubble in Gaza.

props.synopsis: As Israeli special forces executed a daring daytime raid to release four hostages of Hamas, Abdullah watched on before his building was destroyed by an air strike.

title.children: 'Just like you see in American movies': Witness describes Israeli raid to rescue Hamas hostages

image.altText: Two men with stern expressions fron the media

props.synopsis: A former federal South Australian senator representing customers of a Singapore Airlines flight that hit severe turbulence says compensation offers made to passengers on the flight is "mean and miserable".

title.children: Singapore Airlines offer of compensation to passengers 'insulting', former senator says

image.altText: A view of a bay of tropical turquoise water on a mostly sunny day.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu has backed changes in a referendum aiming to end political instability that saw the Pacific nation elect three prime ministers in a month.

title.children: Vanuatu had three PMs in a month. Voters hope a referendum result will stop the churn

image.altText: A grey navy patrol boat sails into a harbour on a cloudy day, with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: A Pacific patrol boat has run aground on its maiden voyage in Fiji, just a few months after it was handed over by the Australian government.

title.children: Navy boat gifted by Australia to Fiji stranded on reef after maiden voyage

image.altText: Bearded man wearing suit eats apple in front of retro court building.

props.synopsis: Tactical protective clothing worn by police officers began to melt and disintegrate after Daniel Gandini allegedly splashed them with acid while they attempted to arrest him, a Tasmanian court hears.

title.children: 'Diplomat Dan' wore goggles and allegedly threw acid on officers when they breached door during siege, court hears

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Victoria Police conclude their latest search in the Ballarat area for clues in the disappearance of Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Victoria Police conclude latest search for clues regarding missing Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy

image.altText: Celine Dion with arms up handing what appears to be a portrait

props.synopsis: Celine Dion has opened up in an interview ahead of the release of her documentary I Am: Celine Dion. The star says she was sick of lying to her fans by not disclosing her stiff person syndrome diagnosis.

title.children: Celine Dion says she couldn't lie to her fans anymore, opens up about stiff person syndrome

image.altText: A tank manouvering.

props.synopsis: Both Israel and Hamas committed war crimes in the early stages of the Gaza war, a United Nations inquiry has found.

title.children: Gaza killings were a crime against humanity, UN inquiry finds

image.altText: a man holding a child and hugging a woman

props.synopsis: Mariam Raad, 32, was one of four women and 13 children who returned to Australia from Syria in October 2022.

title.children: Australian 'ISIS bride' avoids jail time for entering terrorist-controlled Syria

image.altText: A young woman in a blue, button-up shirt stands in front of a marble staircase.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! The ACT's Young Australian of the Year, Caitlin Figueiredo, shares the first big purchase she made at just eight years old, why she won't stop buying people gifts and how she's managed to stop paying rent.

title.children: Pay Day with Caitlin Figueiredo: 'I've lined up back-to-back house-sitting gigs so I don't have to pay rent or utilities'

image.altText: A man smiling and standing infront of a big red car

props.synopsis: Chinese-made electric cars are gaining popularity as a cheaper alternative to brand names like Tesla, and Australia is benefiting from the increased supply.

title.children: Cheaper Chinese electric cars are making their way into Australia, but it's not all good news

image.altText: A damaged, waterlogged road

props.synopsis: The WA opposition says flood damage to the Geraldton-Mount Magnet road shows investment in country roads is being deeply under-resourced.

title.children: Outback truckers halted for days after deluge destroys road, prompting calls for more investment

image.altText: Water bomber in action

props.synopsis: Australia's aerial firefighting fleet is being expanded to include planes that can respond to other disasters such as floods and major storms. It comes as longer and overlapping fire seasons place greater pressure on the existing fleet.

title.children: Australia is about to get more water bombers, but not just for fighting fires

image.altText: A close-up of Dr Michael Mosley talking while leaning his head on his right hand.

props.synopsis: British TV presenter Michael Mosley is reported to have died of natural causes after going missing in Greece. What should Australians do in an emergency situation overseas?

title.children: What should you do in an emergency situation overseas?

image.altText: A split image shows two men wearing suits, one older with a tie, one younger

props.synopsis: The horrible truth is that in the Australian legacy media landscape, there are too many stories of senior men who forgive themselves their own lapses of judgement, or forgive each other's because they're "good blokes", or go easy on each other because they fear a nuclear escalation.

title.children: The shamelessness of powerful men in Australia's media industry knows no bounds

image.altText: Stephanie Kemmerer, smiling widely, wears singlet with words: Former conspiracy theorist. She has curly fair hair and tattooes.

props.synopsis: In the depths of the conspiracy world, Stephanie Kemmerer hated herself and everyone around her. She felt trapped in disinformation — but here's how she finally got out.

title.children: These people were deep conspiracy theory believers for years. Then came an earth-shattering moment

image.altText: Cast iron pot containing lentil bolognese ragu, with a bowl of spaghetti and fresh basil beside it.

props.synopsis: These three meal ideas are simple, delicious and packed full of vegetables.

title.children: Stuck for dinner ideas? Try these three hearty vegetarian recipes

image.altText: A sign out the front of Bacchus Marsh Grammar.

props.synopsis: A parent of a student at Bacchus Marsh Grammar says her daughter was physically ill after seeing fake digital images of students distributed online. A teenager has been arrested and released pending further enquiries.

title.children: 'It's traumatising': Parent shocked at fake nude images of Victorian students

image.altText: A man stands off centre wearing sunnies and holding a phone looking frustrated.

props.synopsis: Residents of Dongara and Port Denison have been without phone coverage since blackouts last Friday, accusing the telco of leaving the community in the dark about repair efforts.

title.children: Six-day Telstra mobile outage leaves residents in country WA at boiling point

image.altText: Brisbane CBD looking down from the City Botanic Gardens boardwalk

props.synopsis: Brisbane landlords will need to apply for a permit before they can list their home for short-term accommodation, including Airbnb, the city's lord mayor has announced.

title.children: Permits required for Brisbane landlords turning their homes into 'mini-hotels', Airbnbs

image.altText: Houses under construction in the background with building materials in the foreground

props.synopsis: Huge demand and lack of supply paint a grim picture for anyone saving to buy their first home, analysts warn.

title.children: Median income earners pushed out of property market amid 'astronomical' price growth

image.altText: Male farmer sitting in utility looking out at solar development

props.synopsis: A farmer with $50 million in public liability insurance says it will not be enough should a fire jump from his place into a new neighbouring solar farm. He says it isn't sufficient to cover "rebuilding an industrial estate" and wants the industry pick up the slack.

title.children: With a solar farm moving in next door, Stephen is worried about his insurance
